PULSARv2.2.TEXT:
Rape, including of female refugees, was a problem.
There were no government restrictions on academic freedom or cultural events.
Individuals who publicly criticized the government often faced reprisal.
Although on a smaller scale than in previous years, interethnic conflict and cross-border raids by Darfur-based militias continued.
There were reports that the government attempted to control criticism by monitoring meetings of the political opposition and that the government attempted to intimidate its critics.
